page.title: 16Milton Keynes Bowl,page 1
page.content: The Milton Keynes Bowl is just north of Bletchley on the A5 trunk road.The Bowl is a man made place, everywhere you look there are trees and bushes. The Bowl is shaped like a half moon about three hundred metres wide and there is a big space in the middle. Lots of people go there for bike rides and picnics and to watch American Football,Jousting,Cycle Races Parachuting,Half Marathons and the Great Balloon Race. Alongside the Bowl there is a stream which runs into Loughton Valley Park where there are three lakes and picnics parks.The Milton Keynes Bowl is an open air grass amphitheatre built on the site of an old brick clay pit.The pit was filled with soil from construction sites througout the city and the amphitheatre was shaped from a soil heap.
